title: Ham and Cheese Crescent Roll-Ups Recipe
description: These ham and cheese crescent roll-ups require just three simple ingredients, making them a quick and easy meal that both kids and adults will love.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Ham and Cheese Crescent Roll-Ups 4.6 (251) 185 Reviews 42 Photos These ham and cheese crescent roll-ups add an easy wow to a weeknight dinner, and they're ready in just 25 minutes. Submitted by Pillsbury Updated on February 24, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 42 42 42 42 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (8 ounce) can Pillsbury® Refrigerated Crescent Dinner Rolls 8 thin slices cooked ham 4 thin slices Cheddar cheese, cut into strips Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Separate crescent dough into 8 triangles. Place 1 ham slice on each triangle; place 2 cheese strips down the center of ham. Fold in the edges of ham to match the shape of dough triangle. Roll up each crescent, ending at the tip of triangle. Place with the tips down on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 19 minutes. Immediately remove from the cookie sheet and serve warm. Yoly I Made It Print 374 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 164 Calories 10g Fat 11g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 164 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 13% Saturated Fat 4g 21% Cholesterol 13mg 4% Sodium 395mg 17% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Total Sugars 2g Protein 6g 11% Vitamin C 4mg 4% Calcium 51mg 4% Iron 0mg 1% Potassium 38mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Ham and Cheese Crescent Roll-Ups 01 of 42 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 42 Photo by  KathyIn WV 07/24/2021 03 of 42 Photo by  Erin Barney 09/29/2020 04 of 42 Photo by  newcook2002 05/21/2020 05 of 42 Photo by  Laura Barahona 04/19/2020 06 of 42 Photo by  Destiny Lynn McGuire 11/12/2019 07 of 42 Photo by  CarlaD 10/29/2018 Will absolutely make again. So easy. I used a half slice of ham and a half slice of packaged cheddar cheese slices. I didn't even tuck the ham in. Rolled up nicely and baked for 17 minutes total. Served with dijon mustard for dipping. Huge hit at my house. 08 of 42 Photo by  Trevors meals 11/08/2017 09 of 42 Photo by  zambibway 09/07/2017 10 of 42 Photo by  Charlotteh 01/26/2017 For how quick these are to make they were pretty good. If I made them again I'd add more cheese and maybe some mustard. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Turkey Wraps 126 Ratings Tortilla Filled with Lunchmeat 5 Ratings Stars and Flowers School Lunch Bagel Sandwich 29 Ratings Good Morning Wrap 25 Ratings Turkey, Cranberry, and Spinach Roll-Ups 25 Ratings Easy French Dip Sandwiches 1,101 Ratings Tiffin on the Greens 1 Rating The Munroe Melt 26 Ratings Fresh Veggie Wraps 15 Ratings Fiesta Pita 13 Ratings Frittata Wrap with Ham and Cheese 2 Ratings California Melt 200 Ratings PBJ 'Sushi' Kid's Bento Box 2 Ratings Carrot Cake Sandwich 7 Ratings Crunchy Curry Tuna Sandwich 16 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Pillsbury
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Separate crescent dough into 8 triangles. Place 1 ham slice on each triangle; place 2 cheese strips down the center of ham. Fold in the edges of ham to match the shape of dough triangle.;Roll up each crescent, ending at the tip of triangle. Place with the tips down on an ungreased cookie sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 19 minutes. Immediately remove from the cookie sheet and serve warm. Yoly
